bug.author: AtarisMio
bug.description:
When I deploy kubeflow follow the guide of <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/>Kubeflow on Kubernetes</denchmark-link> . May something go error? I cannot get resources after . [root@k8s-master ~]# mkdir kubeflow [root@k8s-master ~]# cd kubeflow/ [root@k8s-master kubeflow]# pwd /root/kubeflow [root@k8s-master kubeflow]# export KFAPP=$(pwd) [root@k8s-master kubeflow]# kfctl init ${KFAPP} [root@k8s-master kubeflow]# ls app.yaml [root@k8s-master kubeflow]# kfctl generate all -V INFO[0000] reading from /root/kubeflow/app.yaml filename="coordinator/coordinator.go:341" INFO[0000] reading from /root/kubeflow/app.yaml filename="coordinator/coordinator.go:341" INFO[0000] Ksonnet.Generate Name kubeflow AppDir /root/kubeflow Platform filename="ksonnet/ksonnet.go:369" INFO[0000] Creating environment "default" with namespace "kubeflow", pointing to "version:v1.14.2" cluster at address "https://192.168.213.128:6443" filename="env/create.go:77" INFO[0008] Generating ksonnet-lib data at path '/root/kubeflow/ks_app/lib/ksonnet-lib/v1.14.2' filename="lib/lib.go:148" INFO[0008] Successfully initialized the app kubeflow. filename="ksonnet/ksonnet.go:505" INFO[0008] files filename="registry/cache.go:114" INFO[0008] Retrieved 9 files filename="registry/cache.go:114" INFO[0008] Retrieved 35 files filename="registry/cache.go:114" INFO[0008] Retrieved 49 files filename="cmd/apply.go:35" INFO[0000] reading from /root/kubeflow/app.yaml filename="coordinator/coordinator.go:341" INFO[0000] reading from /root/kubeflow/app.yaml filename="coordinator/coordinator.go:341" INFO[0000] namespace: kubeflow filename="ksonnet/ksonnet.go:109" INFO[0000] Creating namespace: kubeflow filename="ksonnet/ksonnet.go:112" Â∑≤ÊùÄÊ≠ª [root@k8s-master kubeflow]# kubectl -n kubeflow get all No resources found. My system info is this. [root@k8s-master kubeflow]# cat /etc/os-release NAME="CentOS Linux" VERSION="7 (Core)" ID="centos" ID_LIKE="rhel fedora" VERSION_ID="7" PRETTY_NAME="CentOS Linux 7 (Core)" ANSI_COLOR="0;31" CPE_NAME="cpe:/o:centos:centos:7" HOME_URL="https://www.centos.org/" BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.centos.org/"
CENTOS_MANTISBT_PROJECT="CentOS-7" CENTOS_MANTISBT_PROJECT_VERSION="7" REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT="centos" REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT_VERSION="7"
[root@k8s-master kubeflow]# uname -a Linux k8s-master 3.10.0-957.12.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Apr 29 14:59:59 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux [root@k8s-master kubeflow]# cat /etc/hosts 127.0.0.1 localhost localhost.localdomain localhost4 localhost4.localdomain4 ::1 localhost localhost.localdomain localhost6 localhost6.localdomain6 192.168.213.128 k8s-master 192.168.213.129 k8s-node1 192.168.213.130 k8s-node2

linux Architecture: x86_64 CPUs: 2 Total Memory: 972.6MiB Name: k8s-master ID: RN6I:PP52:4WTU:UP7E:T3LF:MXVZ:EDBX:RSII:BIRW:36O2:CYJ3:FRV2 Docker Root Dir: /var/lib/docker Debug Mode (client): false GitCommit:"66049e3b21efe110454d67df4fa62b08ea79a19b", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-05-16T16:23:09Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} Server Version: Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} [root@k8s-master kubeflow]# kubectl get node -A NAME STATUS ROLES AGE VERSION k8s-master Ready master 16h v1.14.2 k8s-node1 Ready <none> 16h v1.14.2 k8s-node2 Ready <none> 16h v1.14.2 [root@k8s-master kubeflow]# kubectl get pods -A NAMESPACE NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE kube-system coredns-fb8b8dccf-8c4bm 1/1 Running 10 16h kube-system coredns-fb8b8dccf-fh6q4 1/1 Running 10 16h kube-system etcd-k8s-master 1/1 Running 9 16h kube-system kube-apiserver-k8s-master 1/1 Running 9 16h kube-system kube-controller-manager-k8s-master 1/1 Running 10 16h kube-system kube-flannel-ds-amd64-98lmm 1/1 Running 4 16h kube-system kube-flannel-ds-amd64-j2nsc 1/1 Running 3 16h kube-system kube-flannel-ds-amd64-tkwhl 1/1 Running 4 16h kube-system kube-proxy-d77ng 1/1 Running 3 16h kube-system kube-proxy-mmzr8 1/1 Running 3 16h kube-system kube-proxy-zkfv8 1/1 Running 3 16h kube-system kube-scheduler-k8s-master 1/1 Running 10 16h kube-system kubernetes-dashboard-5f7b999d65-2pstb 1/1 Running 2 16h the files in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/files/3193855/filelist.txt>filelist.txt</denchmark-link>
How can I resolve this problem? Please help me.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.78. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
I didn't see any errors, did you trump logs or did you key interrupt kfctl apply? Â∑≤ÊùÄÊ≠ª this in Chinese seem like you key interrupted the process?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link>
means . But I don't input any key. It seems to be automatic killed. How can I get more logs for you?

@gabrielwen Â∑≤ÊùÄÊ≠ª means killed. But I don't input any key. It seems to be automatic killed. How can I get more logs for you?
What is the size of your machine's memory? I have encoutered similar problem and solved it after I added machine's memory. @AtrisMio

Following up from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hzliangbin>@hzliangbin</denchmark-link> 's message, if it's a memory problem then probably the OOM killer is responsible for killing the process. Maybe you can verify that problem by searching the dmesg logs. See <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/624857/finding-which-process-was-killed-by-linux-oom-killer>this link</denchmark-link> .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/hzliangbin>@hzliangbin</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link>
Thanks a lot. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hzliangbin>@hzliangbin</denchmark-link> is right, I add memory to my machine, the problem is gone.
